features: GPS 18x USB.The GPS 18x is offered in 3 different cable configurations(GPS 18x PC,GPS 18x USB,GPS 18x LVC)
WAAS Enabled High Sensitivity GPS Receiver
Produces Data ONLY in the GARMIN Proprietary Format
Non Volatile Memory for Storage of Configuration Information
body.description: GARMIN 010-00321-31 GPS 18x USB. The GPS 18x is a GPS sensor targeted to OEM clients for use in automotive, fleet vehicle, and electronics applications where a small, highly accurate GPS receiver is needed. This 12 parallel channel, WAAS enabled GPS receiver is available in either CMOS level serial or USB 2. 0 full speed versions, and comes with an integrated magnetic base. The puck like receiver is 2. 4 inches in diameter and weighs just ounces, making it an ideal solution in applications where space is at a premium. The GPS 18x is offered in three different cable configurations: A style USB, DB 9 pin serial with 12 volt cigarette lighter adapter /PC, or bare wire /LVC. The PC and LVC versions both default to output data in the industry standard NMEA 0183 data format, but may also be user programmed to output data in the GARMIN proprietary format. The USB version produces data only in the GARMIN proprietary format. All three versions of the GPS 18 come complete with non volatile memory for storage of configuration information, a real time clock, and raw measurement output data for sophisticated customer applications. The LVC version additionally provides a pulse per second logic level output whose rising edge is aligned to the UTC second within 1 microsecond. The USB 2. 0 full speed version of the GPS18 is also compatible with USB 1. 1 full speed hosts.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About Us We make products that are engineered on the inside for life on the outside. We do this so our customers can make the most of the time they spend pursuing their passions. Our Mission To be an enduring company by creating superior products for automotive, aviation, marine, outdoor, and sports that are an essential part of our customers’ lives.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars USB GPS SENSOR - I would give this SIX stars if I could!
reviews.reviewText: This product worked GREAT and VERY QUICK with Delorme Street Atlas 2015 but does NOT work with Microsoft Streets and Trips 2013(Now defunct). It DOES work with Garmin GPS PC software very well and quite accurately! Two out of three isn't too bad! This appears to be much more accurate than the standard Delorme sensor and Bluetooth sensor as well. This one seems to be made of far more superior material that will stand up against the elements a bit more than the other. So far I am quite impressed with it's accuracy and quick power up and program recognition ability. If I need another one the you can bet that THIS is the one that I will go to buy again for another vehicle to use!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2011
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars works great and reliable
reviews.reviewText: this is actually my second one. the first one i bought was so easy - plug and play - it's so powerful, it locks on to satellites almost immediately! it's reliable, too. it never gave me a problem, not once since i've had it. so i decided to get another one for my husband's computer and as backup to the old magellan handheld gps that we've got connected to a dedicated PC on our boat for navigation. i've had the cheaper ones and they work okay if you don't mind "choppy" - no choppy with this little hockey puck-style gps!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2012
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars High priced, but solid and reliable
reviews.reviewText: I've owned two of these units, and use them in a mobile environment with a laptop to find utility equipment in municipal environments.I can't use a conventional dashboard GPS due to the need for service people to interchange files that show equipment locations.That being said, this is a solid and reliable unit. My first gave up the ghost after a lot of years due to abuse to it's USB connector. This one works just as well.Interfaces well with the DeLorme laptop mapping software. Unit is weatherproof and durable, and has a strong magnet in the base. Generally, I find leaving it on the dashboard is very sufficient for good results.Cable is long enough to comfortably reach the laptop anywhere in 4 passenger vehicle.A little pricy, but worth it. Depending upon your computer you may need the DeLorme "Spanner" software, or you may need to download drivers for the unit. I found it worked out the box with Windows 7 Pro.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars I shouldve read that it uses proprietary formats
reviews.reviewText: Why not just use the NMEA format ?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
reviews.reviewText: I bought this device several years back for an engineering project, and I only got to use it extensively last week. It works great; position accuracy is great. Be aware that the receiver's data output is Garmin proprietary. If you need NMEA-formatted output to interface with some certain mapping applications such as Streets & Trips, you will have to download (free) Franson GPSGate software which works with a single mouse click. Garmin provides a link to the software download on their customer support website.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2014
reviews.reviewText: This GPS unit was purchased to be used with a laptop and Rose Point Navigation Charts (also purchased from Amazon) when cruising the East Coast of the US, Bahamas, and Caribbean Sea.Although we haven't been on any long voyages with this new items yet this year, test runs have worked out extremely well. We have a Furuno GPS, and several hand held devices as well, but this GPS is dedicated to the lap top.We are very pleased with the current navigational aids.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Works but hard to install.
reviews.reviewText: Does not come with any instructions or software drivers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great GPS for mapping software on PC
reviews.reviewText: Does the job its designed to do. I work in Law enforcement and use this on my mapping software on the computer, it works great. Accuracy down to about 10ft (which is GPS standard i believe) and a low latency so its as real time as possible while moving around.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cant go wrong with Garmin products
reviews.reviewText: Use with navigation software as a backup. Very accurate. Good price
Bought to give Windows 10 GPS for browser and app weather maps. Doesnt work in Windows 10 at all.

Mala experiencia. Lo estoy empleado desde unos 4 meses junto con el software Automapa, en un ordenador portatil con SO, Windows 10. El receptor en si, es reconocido en ordenador solo a traves de un emulador [GpsGate], sin este software el sensor no se puede emplear en windows. Lo peor es que al actualizar el windows (desde Windows Aniversary hasta ahorra), hay un conflicto entre sistema operativo y los drivers de Garmin (incompletos y obsolentos, ultima version en feb. 2019, que no corrige errores). Este conflicto en concreto hace que el receptor Garmin no es reconocido como una entrada por usb... Por otra parte tras actualizar windows, no se por que razones, el receptor aun que tenga cojidos entre 8 y 10 satelites, manda una informacion al Automapa, como "señal gps debil". Consecuencia: con este receptor no se puede navegar en tiempo real. Hasta dia de hoy no hay ninguna solucion ofrecida por parte de Garmin. Si te quieres gastar entre 60 y 80 euros en un producto que ya no interesa a Garmin mantenerlo al dia, es tu eleccion....
